articleContent.title: Chord: Minor Major 7th in G# (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Minor Major 7th in G# (Shape: E)

## Overview
The Minor Major 7th chord in the key of G# (Shape: E) is a complex and unique chord that consists of the following notes: G# (Root), B# (Minor 3rd), D# (Perfect 5th), and F## (Major 7th). This chord combination creates a rich and melancholic sound that can add depth and tension to your music.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- B# (Minor 3rd)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- F## (Major 7th)

## Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th chord in G# (Shape: E) is commonly used in jazz, soul, and R&B genres. It has a mysterious and introspective quality, often evoking emotions of longing and introspection. The dissonance created by the major 7th interval adds a touch of sophistication and tension to the chord, making it a favorite among musicians looking to add complexity to their compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Minor Major 7th chord in G# (Shape: E):
1. "Every Breath You Take" by The Police
2. "I Will Always Love You" by Whitney Houston
3. "Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra
